title: Drawing, "Design  for a Decorative Vase", 1750–1800
medium: Brush and brown wash, pen and brown ink on paper
provenance: From the Collection of Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr and Mrs Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: An amphora, seen diagonally.  Around the body and the neck an ivy branch.  At the end of the handles a satyr mask.  The background tinted light brown; the shadow is indicated.  On the back written in pencil: "con matteo nosselli 12."

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design  for a Decorative Vase", 1750–1800.
1750–1800. Brush and brown wash, pen and brown ink on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3163.
